meanings.definition: Torticollises: a medical condition characterized by the involuntary contraction of neck muscles causing the head to twist to one side.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her torticollises after noticing her head was tilted to the side.
meanings.sent2: People with torticollises may experience discomfort due to the neck muscle contractions.
meanings.sent3: Despite her torticollises, she managed to keep a positive attitude and a smile on her face.
meanings.sent4: Her torticollises made her feel like she was constantly looking over her shoulder, even when she wasn't.
meanings.sent5: The image of her twisted neck due to torticollises stayed vividly in his mind.

meanings.definition: Torticollises: the plural form of torticollis, a condition affecting the neck muscles.
meanings.sent1: The hospital treated multiple cases of torticollises last month.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying the causes of torticollises to find better treatments.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked about starting a torticollises support group.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of people with torticollises, it looked like a sea of tilted heads.
meanings.sent5: The impact of torticollises on daily life became more apparent as time passed.
